newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate rises to 9.0 percent.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate rises to 9.0 percent.

text.p: Croatia's average lending rate rose to 9.0 percent from 8.1 percent despite low demand as most transactions were due to prolonged long-term loans.
Dealers said fresh demand amounted to only 2.2 million kuna and total settlements were down at 22.5 million kuna.
Call money jumped to 9.7 percent from 7.0 while 10-15 day loans fell to 8.0 percent from 12.5 percent.
Overnight trade totalled 60 million kuna as only one bank with shortfalls traded.

The National Bank of Croatia stayed out of the foreign exchange market on Thursday. Its kuna midrates for Friday eased slightly to 5.2632 against the dollar and to 3.5459 versus the mark. -- Metka Jelenc, Zagerb Newsrom, 385-1-4557075.
